issues.issue_title: Request for ᏣᎳᎩ ᎦᏬᏂᎯᏍᏗ (Cherokee) language option
issues.issue_body:
### Pitch

Requesting that an option for ᏣᎳᎩ ᎦᏬᏂᎯᏍᏗ (Cherokee language) be added to the list of languages when posting on Mastodon. 
 
Language codes:
ISO 639-2 — [chr](https://www.loc.gov/standards/iso639-2/php/langcodes_name.php?code_ID=90)
ISO 639-3 — [chr](https://iso639-3.sil.org/code/chr)

ᏣᎳᎩ (Cherokee)

### Motivation

https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cherokee_language

> Cherokee or Tsalagi (Cherokee: ᏣᎳᎩ ᎦᏬᏂᎯᏍᏗ, Tsalagi Gawonihisdi [[dʒalaˈɡî ɡawónihisˈdî]](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Help:IPA)) is an endangered-to-[moribund](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moribund_language)[[a]](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cherokee_language#cite_note-11) [Iroquoian language](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iroquoian_languages)[[4]](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cherokee_language#cite_note-Ethnologue18-4) and the [native language](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Native_language) of the [Cherokee](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cherokee) people

Active Cherokee speaker and ones learning the language would benefits from this option.

commit.commit_title: Better hashtag normalization when processing a post (#26614)

prs.pr_title: Better hashtag normalization when processing a post
prs.pr_body:
This should fix the hashtag issues with accentuated letters

- NKFC normalization, like in the Ruby code
- `sensitivity: 'base'` for Collator, so we compare base characters, to emulate ASCII folding made in Ruby (but efficiently?)

I hope that configuring the collator this way will work like the ASCII folding the Ruby does, otherwise we will need to do per-character processing of every hashtag, which does not feel efficient. Possible issues here are with non-latin languages.

The collator can accept an array of languages, so we could feed it with the post language, but I am not sure how much it would help. We need real examples to test this.

issues.issue_title: Text formatting
issues.issue_body: Hi, I worked a bit to support text formatting for `**` to `` and `*` to ``. You can find a demo [here](https://share.elouworld.org/@Exagone313/996). I'm wondering if such feature would be acceptable? I would submit a PR if yes. Here is my current diff, that works only for messages sent on the current instance (this code isn't ready for prod, I'd need some help for that): ```diff diff --git a/app/lib/formatter.rb b/app/lib/formatter.rb index da7ad202..9cf07400 100644 --- a/app/lib/formatter.rb +++ b/app/lib/formatter.rb @@ -14,6 +14,7 @@ class Formatter html = status.text html = encode(html) + html = strong_em_html(html) html = simple_format(html, {}, sanitize: false) html = html.gsub(/\n/, '') html = link_urls(html) @@ -36,6 +37,7 @@ class Formatter return reformat(account.note) unless account.local? html = encode(account.note) + html = strong_em_html(html) html = link_urls(html) html = link_accounts(html) html = link_hashtags(html) @@ -98,4 +100,8 @@ class Formatter def mention_html(match, account) "#{match.split('@').first}@#{account.username}" end + + def strong_em_html(html) + html.gsub(/(^| )[*][*]([^*]+)[*][*]( |$)/, '\1\2\3').gsub(/(^| )[*]([^*]+)[*]( |$)/, '\1\2\3') + end end ``` * * * * - [x] I searched or browsed the repo’s other issues to ensure this is not a duplicate.

commit.commit_title: Fix unexpected audio stream transcoding when uploaded video is eligible to passthrough (#26608)

prs.pr_title: Fix unexpected audio stream transcoding when uploaded video is eligible to passthrough
prs.pr_body:
This commit fixes duplicated codec options incorrectly passed to ffmpeg.

When the uploaded video meets `eligible_to_passthrough?` conditions, the `-c:v copy -c:a copy` option is passed to avoid transcoding the video and audio streams. However, the `-c:a copy` option is ignored because it is overridden by the `-acodec aac`. As a result, the audio stream will be transcoded by the `aac` encoder, resulting in a loss of audio quality.

Before: 

```
mastodon-sidekiq-1  | Command :: ffmpeg -nostdin -i '/tmp/*****.mp4' -loglevel 'fatal' -map_metadata '-1' -c:v 'copy' -c:a 'copy' -acodec 'aac' -strict 'experimental' -y '/tmp/*****.mp4'
```

After:

```
mastodon-sidekiq-1  | Command :: ffmpeg -nostdin -i '/tmp/*****.mp4' -loglevel 'fatal' -map_metadata '-1' -c:v 'copy' -c:a 'copy' -y '/tmp/*****.mp4'
```

Difference in ffmpeg logs:

```diff
-$ ffmpeg -nostdin -i /tmp/aaa.mp4 -hide_banner -map_metadata '-1' -c:v 'copy' -c:a 'copy' -acodec 'aac' -strict 'experimental' -y /tmp/bbb.mp4
+$ ffmpeg -nostdin -i /tmp/aaa.mp4 -hide_banner -map_metadata '-1' -c:v 'copy' -c:a 'copy' -y /tmp/bbb.mp4
 Input #0, mov,mp4,m4a,3gp,3g2,mj2, from '/tmp/aaa.mp4':
   Metadata:
     major_brand     : isom
     minor_version   : 512
     compatible_brands: isomiso2avc1mp41
     encoder         : Lavf58.45.100
   Duration: 00:00:08.30, start: 0.000000, bitrate: 1498 kb/s
     Stream #0:0(und): Video: h264 (High) (avc1 / 0x31637661), yuv420p, 1600x1200, 1360 kb/s, 60 fps, 60 tbr, 15360 tbn, 120 tbc (default)
     Metadata:
       handler_name    : VideoHandler
     Stream #0:1(und): Audio: aac (LC) (mp4a / 0x6134706D), 44100 Hz, stereo, fltp, 128 kb/s (default)
     Metadata:
       handler_name    : SoundHandler
-Multiple -c, -codec, -acodec, -vcodec, -scodec or -dcodec options specified for stream 1, only the last option '-c:a aac' will be used.
 Output #0, mp4, to '/tmp/bbb.mp4':
   Metadata:
     encoder         : Lavf58.45.100
     Stream #0:0: Video: h264 (High) (avc1 / 0x31637661), yuv420p, 1600x1200, q=2-31, 1360 kb/s, 60 fps, 60 tbr, 15360 tbn, 15360 tbc (default)
     Stream #0:1: Audio: aac (LC) (mp4a / 0x6134706D), 44100 Hz, stereo, fltp, 128 kb/s (default)
-    Metadata:
-      encoder         : Lavc58.91.100 aac
 Stream mapping:
   Stream #0:0 -> #0:0 (copy)
-  Stream #0:1 -> #0:1 (aac (native) -> aac (native))
+  Stream #0:1 -> #0:1 (copy)
 Press [q] to stop, [?] for help
```

issues.issue_title: Out-of-band hashtags not hidden in posts with content warnings
issues.issue_body:
### Steps to reproduce the problem

1. Compose a new post with a content warning and a hashtag on the last line
2. Publish the post
3. When you view the post collapsed (default when viewing posts with content warnings) the regular content is hidden, but the hashtag is not.

![afbeelding](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/assets/41594439/f4de532f-0025-4612-a3f2-3df7c85a1c22)

### Expected behaviour

Hashtags in a post with content warnings should be part of the hidden post content, because hashtags mostly have the same issues as the text or media content (think especially about NSFW content here). _Edit: I think the easiest way to fix this is is to disable out-of-band hashtags for CW posts all together._

### Actual behaviour

Hashtag is shown as out-of-band, like regular posts

### Mastodon instance

mastodon.social

### Mastodon version

v4.2.0+nightly-2023-08-22

### Browser name and version

Firefox 116.0.3

### Operating system

Ubuntu 23.04

commit.commit_title: Fix some React warnings (#26609)

prs.pr_title: Fix some React warnings
prs.pr_body:
Fix three different React warnings. I think the warnings are just warnings and not actual bugs, but let's get rid of the noise the browser console.

1. Warning: Received `false` for a non-boolean attribute `className`.
If you want to write it to the DOM, pass a string instead: className="false" or className={value.toString()}.
If you used to conditionally omit it with className={condition && value}, pass className={condition ? value : undefined} instead.
2. Warning: Failed prop type: Invalid prop `previousId` of type `boolean` supplied to `Status`, expected `string`.
3. Warning: Function components cannot be given refs. Attempts to access this ref will fail. Did you mean to use React.forwardRef()?
Check the render method of `Bundle`.

commit.commit_title: Change hashtag bar tags to be de-emphasized (#26606)

prs.pr_title: Change hashtag bar tags to be de-emphasized
prs.pr_body:
The original reasoning for the change is in #26260:

> People will often put all of the hashtags relevant to the post at the end of the post, but it looks spammy. Others avoid using hashtags this way because it looks spammy, and therefore lose out on discoverability. Since hashtags on Mastodon are out-of-band on the protocol and API level anyway, we can continue to allow them to be input the usual way but render them out-of-band in a more clean manner.

However, the actual change made the hashtags more prominent, which I don't think matches the intent.

## Before this PR

![image](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/assets/384364/3e521160-e7b3-4fb6-aa1c-aa39cd839d73)

## After this PR

![image](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/assets/384364/3e343ca7-565e-41e9-a7c9-34baa16493c5)

issues.issue_title: Add push notifications so mobile apps can register
issues.issue_body:
Add an API so apps can register devices to receive push notifications. Send push notifications to user's devices for the same events as those which trigger e-mail notifications.

This would probably be limited to Android first, then expanded to iOS.

There should be optional configuration options for the API keys required to interact with Android/iOS. Each instance admin would be responsible for acquiring those. The API should return an error code when an app tries to register device on an instance that doesn't have it set up.

issues.issue_title: Remove follows/follower counts
issues.issue_body:
I think perhaps that quantification of followers/following incentivizes a culture of performer/audience and/or creates stigmas around the ratio, which aren't desirable.

It may be nice to replace the counts with just a "mutuals" count or remove them all together.

At the very least it would be nice to have this discussion.

prs.pr_title: Fix timeout on invalid set of exclusionary parameters in `/api/v1/timelines/public`
prs.pr_body:
This PR is an attempt to fix #22024.

I'm not quite sure this solves the timeout problem as I can't replicate it locally.

With this change, both `local_only?` and `remote_only?` return false, as if no parameter were given, or as if both `remote` and `local` were `false`.

I'm not quite sure this is the best approach, maybe returning HTTP 400 as suggested in the issue?

I appreciate any suggestions!

issues.issue_title: Timeout on invalid set of exclusionary parameters when fetching timeline
issues.issue_body:
### Steps to reproduce the problem

1. Choose a Mastodon instance
2. Send the following request `/api/v1/timelines/public?local=true&remote=true`
3. See that the request takes too long (>30 seconds)

### Expected behaviour

Either an empty array or straight up return with 400 detailing that the query parameters are invalid 

### Actual behaviour

Request times out

### Detailed description

I noticed that when you are fetching a timeline with both `local` and `remote` query parameters set to true, that the request would timeout. I have tested this with mastodon.social, mastodon.online, and a few others. The issue does not appear when those parameters are not set.

### Specifications

Mastodon 4.0.2

issues.issue_title: Automatically position cursor when writing a reply toot
issues.issue_body: When creating a new reply toot, this positions the cursor at the end of the textbox - I find that a lot more useful for writing new toots. This mimics Tweetbot's behaviour of selecting any usernames past the first when replying. This makes it a lot easier to drop people from a conversation when replying, which I find encourages good reply etiquette. Before: After:

commit.commit_title: Add new public status index (#26344)

prs.pr_title: Add new public status index
prs.pr_body: This is a follow up to https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/25951 The idea here is to allow `public` posts by `discoverable` users to show up in search results. This is done by adding a new Public Status Index to Elastic Search. A status is added to the `PublicStatusesIndex` if the status's visibility is `public` and if the account is `discoverable`. Note: This will only work on instances with Elastic Search enabled. ## Outstanding questions 1. I'm not really sure how to test the changes to the Mastodon CLI. How do I do that? Can someone point me in the right direction there? 2. I'm also not sure how to know if the vacuum changes are working. 3. I wanted to add a few more tests for the `AccountStatusesSearch` concern, but I think I might need to add a new gem to do that (`chewy_spec`). I'm not sure what the process is for adding new gems. Is that something I can just do, or perhaps if there is a conversation that should happen first. ## Examples Two `public` posts were made. One from a `discoverable` account and one from a `non-discoverable` account. You can see both of these posts in the `StatusesIndex` However, you can only see one of these posts, the one by the `discoverable` account, in the `PublicStatusesIndex` Any random user can then search for the string `hello` and only the public post will be returned from that search query ## Account Deletion An account creates a public post When/if that account is deleted, so are its posts. ## Discoverable --> Non-discoverable If a `discoverable` account posts something And then switches the `discoverability` of their account, the posts are removed from the `public` index ## Non-discoverable --> Discoverable But if they then post again and then switch back, all the posts are returned to the index ___ Fixes MAS-88

commit.commit_title: Add `data-nosnippet` attribute to remote posts and local posts with `noindex` (#26648)

prs.pr_title: Add `data-nosnippet` attribute to remote posts and local posts with `noindex`
prs.pr_body:
Currently, when opting out of “Include profile page in search engines”, `noindex` is set on pages that are “owned” by the account, but that does not affect pages that are “owned” by other accounts and can still include posts from the user who has opted out (e.g. replies, parent posts, or boosts in an account's profile).

As far as I know, search engines do not offer any capability to prevent indexing part of a page (e.g. you want to index a post, but not all of its replies), but `data-nosnippet` is the next best thing, as it should prevent the post content itself from appearing in the search result.

I am not sure how this affects indexing, if at all.

Other alternatives may be to make whole pages `noindex` if even a single post on it is from a `noindex` account (but that may severely hamper searchability of people who do want to be searchable), or omitting those posts altogether from logged-out pages, which risks being extremely confusing and detrimental to the user experience.

commit.commit_title: Change the pre-release versioning scheme and associated environment variables (#26653)

prs.pr_title: Change the pre-release versioning scheme and associated environment variables
prs.pr_body:
Instead of exposing the loosely-defined `MASTODON_VERSION_FLAGS` and `MASTODON_VERSION_SUFFIX` flags, expose `MASTODON_VERSION_PRERELEASE` and `MASTODON_VERSION_METADATA` that reflect the “prerelease” and “build metadata” components of semver.

That is, instead of `major.minor.patch${MASTODON_VERSION_FLAGS}${MASTODON_VERSION_SUFFIX}`, the version is `major.minor.patch-${MASTODON_VERSION_PRERELEASE}+{MASTODON_VERSION_METADATA}` (with the `-` and `+` only being added if needed).

The idea is to have the following pre-release “channels”:
- development branch (until going into the alpha/beta prerelease phase): `X.Y.0-0.dev.N` where `X.Y.0` targets the *next* minor/major and `N` can be bumped when important changes (such as security fixes) are implemented in the main branch
- alpha/beta/rc pre-releases: `X.Y.0-alphaN`, `X.Y.0-betaN`, `X.Y.0-rcN`
- nightly builds: `X.Y.0-nightly.YYYY-MM-DD` where `X.Y.0` targets the *next* minor/major

PRs builds would not be their own pre-release “channel” but have the information in build metadata:
- this would be in build metadata only as `+pr-PR_NUMBER-COMMIT_SHORT_HASH`

This way:
- nightly builds are comparable between themselves and actual releases
- standard prereleases and releases are comparable between themselves
- development branch versions are somewhat comparable between themselves and with standard prereleases, and they are comparable with actual releases

This will be useful for #26582

issues.issue_title: Reorganise menus
issues.issue_body:
Hello 🙂 I reopened Mastodon after months of not visiting and it’s great to see how it all evolved and grew up! The menu in the right column in addition to the icons menu in left column is a welcome addition, but there’s something inconsistent and somewhat bothering:

**The left menu icons:**
- Getting started `#` `+`
- Public `#` `+`
- Preferences `*` `+`
- Sign out `*` `+`

**The right menu items:**
- Getting started `#` `+`
- Public `#` `+`
- Preferences `*` `+`
- Favourites `#`
- Blocked users `#`
- Extended information `*`
- Sign out `*` `+`

`#` Octothorpes denote links opening content in the right column.
`*` Asterisks denote links to “external” pages.
`+` Pluses denote duplicate links.

See? I think it can all be made more nice & logical:
* No duplicates, they just take space and may be confusing.
* Things that open in the right column are to be in the right column menu.
* Things that don’t open in the right column have nothing to do in the right column menu.
* Then, left icons for everything else.
* Additionally, ‘Extended information’ can also be a text link at the end of the ‘Getting started’ copy.

I also believe that the icon menu would live better at the bottom of the left column rather than at the top. They are asides that you don’t have to see first thing when you open. It’s better to start with search and tooting, which are the main features.

Here’s a screenshot of the proposition:
![Mastodon reorganised](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/923008/23058144/d4cfded8-f4f3-11e6-9316-79cd42c87f71.png)

issues.issue_title: Phrase search fails on trailing punctuation
issues.issue_body:
### Steps to reproduce the problem

1. A post with trailing punctuation on a word (e.g. "indexed publicly.")
2. Phrase search for the phrase _without_ the trailing punctuation (e.g. search for "indexed publicly")


### Expected behaviour

Post is found

### Actual behaviour

Post is not found unless you include the trailing punctuation in the search

### Detailed description

It looks like when doing phrase search trailing punctuation on the words is required to match. This is very counterintuitive. If the search phrase includes trailing punctuation then it should be required, but if the search phrase doesn't have trailing punctuation it should still match posts that do have trailing punctuation.

In general, someone searching for a phrase has no idea if it appears at the end of a sentence or not.

### Mastodon instance

mastodon.social

### Mastodon version

v4.2.0-beta2+pr-26657-fdd14a0

### Technical details

_No response_

commit.commit_title: Fix bad search type heuristic (#26673)

prs.pr_title: Fix bad search type heuristic
prs.pr_body: Previously, hashtags would not be searched if the query contained a `@` (which is fair enough, but far from the only invalid hashtag character!), accounts would not be searched if they contained both a `@` and a space (presumably because it indicates we're searching for status text?), and statuses would not be searched if the query contained a `@` and no spaces. What the last part meant is that e.g. `from:@username` would not give the expected results even though in combination with a space and any other segment, it would behave correctly. The idea was originally to save resources by only searching the sources that are likely intended, but I think that's not worth optimizing.

commit.commit_title: Improve error messages when DeepL quota is exceeded (#26704)

prs.pr_title: Improve error messages when DeepL quota is exceeded
prs.pr_body:
The DeepL free tier has a quota of 500,000 translated characters per month which is relatively easy to hit on busier servers. Even with the DeepL pro tier, you can still run into this error when you have cost control enabled.

The current handling makes it look like the Mastodon server has an internal server error when the quota is exceeded. Back when we were still on the free tier we would often get reports from users about the server being broken towards the end of the month because of the nondescript error.

I'm not super happy with the wording of the messages though, so if someone has suggestions for that..

Before:

![image](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/assets/179393/2e4c0699-c603-4873-9dd1-22e09454b890)

After:

![image](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/assets/179393/344194a1-16b8-4cac-b4c8-cf256c90d069)

commit.commit_title: Improve Codespaces port forwarding (#26400)

prs.pr_title: Improve Codespaces port forwarding
prs.pr_body:
Several improvements for the GitHub Codespaces setup:

- Disable request forgery protection. Codespaces rewrites the `Origin` header to `localhost:3000` but not the `Host` header, and this triggers Rails' forgery protection, e.g. when submitting the login form.
- Use HTTPS for streaming, because Codespaces [does not support websockets](https://github.com/orgs/community/discussions/3908).
- Describe in README how to manually mark port 4000 as “public” to work around [a Codespaces limitation](https://github.com/orgs/community/discussions/15351) regarding CORS.
- Create [separate devcontainer.json files](https://containers.dev/implementors/spec/#devcontainerjson) for Codespaces and local development. The environment variables defined for Codespaces does not work with local development.
- Add [port labels](https://docs.github.com/en/codespaces/developing-in-codespaces/forwarding-ports-in-your-codespace#automatically-labeling-a-forwarded-port) for better overview in Visual Studio Code.
- Specify `notify` so the user is only about port 3000.

commit.commit_title: Fix bug with favourited view on Toots only showing latest favouriting accounts (#26577)

prs.pr_title: Fix bug with favourited view on Toots only showing latest favouriting accounts
prs.pr_body:
Closes #26575 

Updates the "favourited by" details on a toot to use the paginated API and display the full list of accounts that have favourited, rather than only showing the most recent 40 (or other configured default).

issues.issue_title: 'Favorites' list only shows most recent 40-item page
issues.issue_body:
### Steps to reproduce the problem

1. [This toot](https://social.coop/@smallcircles/110755972839994395) is now favorited 259 times
2. Whenever clicking on favorites icon below the toot to /favorites only last 40 items are shown, no option to load more.
...


### Expected behaviour

Full list of favoriters should be displayed, or a load more button to fetch the next page of favoriters.

### Actual behaviour

Only the lastest 40 favoriters are displayed and no option to load more.

### Detailed description

Discovered while addressing similar issue, https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/issues/26121. The frontend code that displays the favorites only ever calls the favorites API once, regardless of whether or not a paginated link is returned.

### Mastodon instance

social.coop

### Mastodon version

v4.1.4

### Browser name and version

Firefox 115.0, Chrome 115.0.5790.173

### Operating system

Windows 10 (user), Ubuntu 23.04 (server)

### Technical details

Details in the similar issue https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/issues/26121 apply here as well, the code for these two views is nearly identical.

issues.issue_title: 'Reblogs' list only shows most recent 40-item page
issues.issue_body:
### Steps to reproduce the problem

1. [This toot](https://social.coop/@smallcircles/110755972839994395) is now boosted 206 times
2. Whenever clicking on boost icon below the toot to `/reblogs` only last 40 items are shown.
3. And there's no UI chrome to show more than the 40-item page.
...


### Expected behaviour

Either the full list of 'boosters' is shown, or UI to navigate between pages.

### Actual behaviour

Only the most recent 40 accounts are shown that boosted the toot

### Detailed description

Just extra FYI. Helge in [fediverse devs](https://matrix.to/#/!uHqAjmOtrLtidOiczC:matrix.org/$i4Us6bxM1ucWrWJpNBvxMpWx50CIqWbvUv20_xxhm-s?via=matrix.org&via=mozilla.org&via=matrix.bottomservices.club) chat made aware that the API call is paged:

> https://social.coop/api/v1/statuses/110755972839994395/reblogged_by
> Then if you look at the headers you see
> Link: https://social.coop/api/v1/statuses/110755972839994395/reblogged_by?max_id=110757548633191096; rel="next", https://social.coop/api/v1/statuses/110755972839994395/reblogged_by?since_id=110758036549519882; rel="prev"
> I think you need to select next to get the next 40 entries.
> Then if you do it 4 times, you get everybody who reblogged.

### Mastodon instance

social.coop

### Mastodon version

v4.1.4

### Browser name and version

Firefox 115.0

### Operating system

Ubuntu 23.04

### Technical details

_No response_

issues.issue_title: Bump version to 1.4.0.2
Lazy load toots using IntersectionObserver
issues.issue_body:
An attempt at fixing #2900 using  [`IntersectionObserver`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/IntersectionObserver) instead of scroll listeners and libraries.

Workflow:
 - Render all the toots and save their height
 - Use `IntersectionObserver` to compute which toots are in the viewport. Toots that are outside get replaced with a `div` containing the author and status content (in order for browser search to continue working). The `div` has the original height, maintaining the list scrolling.
 - Render toots that are visible in the scrolling container plus a few more before and after. This avoids displaying the empty `div` (which has `opacity: 0`).

In case swapping between the actual toot and the placeholder `div` is not fast enough, I have  added a fade-in effect to make the loading appear smoother. You may see this on mobile or if you are scrolling fast.

[Browser support](http://caniuse.com/#feat=intersectionobserver): Chrome and Edge 15. Firefox and WebKit are currently implementing it - the [official WICG polyfill](https://github.com/WICG/IntersectionObserver/tree/gh-pages/polyfill) is used meanwhile.

issues.issue_title: Default puma to running on localhost only.
issues.issue_body:
I see https://github.com/tootsuite/mastodon/issues/1283 was closed but web and streaming, when installed using the production guide, both default to listening on 0.0.0.0 though the production guide sets them up to only be needed internally.

I also see https://github.com/tootsuite/mastodon/pull/1747/files which did similar but closed due to inactivity.

This fixes the web service, the streaming can be fixed in the production guide so I'll submit a PR there too.

You can still choose to listen on 0.0.0.0 by running puma with the `--bind` option.

commit.commit_title: Change text extraction in `PlainTextFormatter` to be faster (#26727)

prs.pr_title: Fix inefficiencies in `PlainTextFormatter`
prs.pr_body:
Profiling `tootctl search deploy` revealed that over 50% of the CPU time was spent in `PlainTextFormatter#to_s`.

This replaces the two-step stripping and decoding with parsing using `#text` from Nokogiri, with a very simple sanitization step consistent with our full HTML-oriented sanitization to completely remove some elements (not doing so would not lead to a security risk, but would increase inconsistencies).

For the overwhelming majority of posts (I tested on 900k of the most recent remote posts known to my server and found no differences), this results in the exact same string, but performs about three times as fast (processing the 40k most recent remote posts known to my server took 100s with the old code, and 30s with the new code).

commit.commit_title: Add avatar image to webfinger responses (#26558)

prs.pr_title: Add avatar image to webfinger responses
prs.pr_body:
Closes https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/issues/26557

Adds an avatar link to webfinger responses. The avatar field is defined in the spec here https://webfinger.net/rel/

> `http://webfinger.net/rel/avatar`
> The link relation http://webfinger.net/rel/avatar identifies a person’s avatar and may be in any standard image format (e.g., PNG, JPEG, GIF).

issues.issue_title: Add avatar image to webfinger responses
issues.issue_body:
### Pitch

The avatar field is defined in the spec here https://webfinger.net/rel/

> `http://webfinger.net/rel/avatar`
> The link relation http://webfinger.net/rel/avatar identifies a person’s avatar and may be in any standard image format (e.g., PNG, JPEG, GIF).

### Motivation

I work on the browser extension StreetPass (https://streetpass.social/) and would love a way to display the users profile photo if available! 

Adding the avatar to the webfinger response would allow streetpass to retrieve this value 100% client side. Other client-side solutions, like fetching a profile url with `application/activity+json`, break if the instance has AUTHORIZED_FETCH turned on. I would greatly prefer streetpass to remain a 100% client-side application (no server-side logic for resolving profiles) for simplicity and privacy reasons.

prs.pr_body: Fixes #26236.

issues.issue_title: `/api/v1/timelines/tag/:hashtag` allows unauthenticated access despite instance settings
issues.issue_body:
### Steps to reproduce the problem

1. Change instance settings and disable public preview of timelines
2. Make an unauthenticated request to the `/api/v1/timelines/tag/:hashtag` endpoint


### Expected behaviour

HTTP 401 Unauthorized

### Actual behaviour

HTTP 200

### Detailed description

According to the documentation (see [here](https://docs.joinmastodon.org/methods/timelines/#tag)), this endpoint should require a token if the instance has the public preview of timelines disabled. However, it allows for unauthenticated requests.

### Mastodon instance

_No response_

### Mastodon version

_No response_

### Technical details

If this is happening on your own Mastodon server, please fill out those:
- Ruby version: ruby 3.2.2 (2023-03-30 revision e51014f9c0) [x86_64-linux]
- Node.js version: v16.20.1

commit.commit_title: Fix search queries with slash causing or-condition (#26699)

prs.pr_title: Fix search queries with slash causing or-condition
prs.pr_body: Searching for `ios/android` would yield results with either `ios` or `android`. This is because our own parser tokenizes user input on spaces, and the resulting clauses are combined using "and". However the slash would cause both words to be treated as a single clause; the default operator of the `most_fields` query, which is "or", would then come into effect.

commit.commit_title: Fix not being able to invoke phrase search using unicode quotation marks (#26687)

prs.pr_title: Fix not being able to invoke phrase search using unicode quotation marks

issues.issue_title: "Search for phrase" should support quote marks beyond " (U+0022)
issues.issue_body:
### Pitch

To search for an entire phrase, the user currently needs to quote the phrase using QUOTATION MARK (Unicode U+0022). Many people use software that automatically replaces this character by typographic quotation marks (for US English, LEFT DOUBLE QUOTATION MARK U+201C and RIGHT DOUBLE QUOTATION MARK U+201D). This software often makes it difficult to type U+0022 unless you use a workaround. It would be great to accept the typographic marks as well as the ASCII version.

In addition, other languages use different styles of quotation marks, and it would be good to support as many of them as possible. E.g., single marks for UK English, guillemets for French, etc). Here is a reasonably complete set of such characters: “”‘’„«»「」『』'"《》

Reference: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quotation_mark

### Motivation

This would make phrase search considerably easier for people who use typographic (curly) quotes, as well as users of other languages.

commit.commit_title: Fix unmatched quotes and prefixes causing search to fail (#26701)

prs.pr_title: Fix unmatched quotes and prefixes causing search to fail
prs.pr_body: Treats `foo:` as just a term search for `foo`. Treats unknown prefix `foo:bar` as an impossible condition that gives no results.

commit.commit_title: Revert to using primary database in IndexingScheduler (#26754)

prs.pr_title: Revert to using primary database in IndexingScheduler
prs.pr_body:
Partially reverts #26692, as there is no guarantee for the posts to have reached the replica when the scheduler tries to process them.

I did not change `AddToPublicStatusesIndexWorker` because those perform more work and the cases in which a post would fail to index are extremely likely.

I do not think reverting to use the primary poses any significant performance issue, as the performance issues we did see were caused by unrelated bugs (N+1, seq scan and reindexing of too many posts, all of which have been fixed)

prs.pr_title: Add `authorized_fetch` server setting in addition to env var
prs.pr_body:
The environment variable is still usable and overrides the setting.

There are two reasons this does not completely replace the environment variable:
- using an environment variable saves the cost of doing a Redis call on every page hit
- a migration path from environment variable to setting is not an obvious thing to do

This is primarily meant to hosted server administrators who cannot easily set env variables.

commit.commit_title: Move to ioredis for streaming (#26581)

prs.pr_title: Move to ioredis for streaming
prs.pr_body:
As discovered in https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26571, the current streaming server uses a Redis client that is incompatible with some nice-to-haves when it comes to Redis, specifically Sentinel and Cluster. This PR moves to [ioredis][1], which does support these features and is generally better supported.

I have done my best to test these changes, and following the [migration guide][2] it _seems_ fairly straightforward, but there may be some edge cases I haven't caught.

[1]: https://github.com/redis/ioredis
[2]: https://github.com/redis/ioredis/wiki/Migrating-from-node_redis

commit.commit_title: Add admin notifications for new Mastodon versions (#26582)

prs.pr_title: Add admin notifications for new Mastodon versions
prs.pr_body:
## How this works

This checks `https://api.joinmastodon.org/update-check?version=<current_version>` every 30 minutes for new versions. Unlike most other requests made by Mastodon, the user-agent does not include the server's name. `current_version` is the textual representation of the Mastodon version, with everything after a `+` stripped so that build metadata is not used for version computation nor allows identifying the fork or server name.

This way (together with upcoming updates in our versioning scheme), soft forks should be covered. Forks with different versioning schemes should change the update checker behavior, its endpoint URL, or disable it entirely.

This endpoint URL can be overridden with the `UPDATE_CHECK_URL` environment variable, and the check can be disabled altogether by setting this variable to a blank value, which is useful for people wanting to avoid “phoning home” behavior or running managed hosting.

When new versions are detected, a mail is sent to each user with the “DevOps” permission according to their e-mail notification settings (this only happens once per new version).

The plan is to have `https://api.joinmastodon.org/update-check` return a JSON object depending on which updates are available for a particular branch. For instance, consider you are on `v4.2.0` and a new critical update is available, as well as a new minor version of Mastodon:
```json
{
  "updatesAvailable": [
    {
      "version": "4.2.1",
      "urgent": true,
      "type": "patch",
      "releaseNotes": "https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/releases/v4.2.1"
    },
    {
      "version": "4.3.1",
      "urgent": false,
      "type": "minor",
      "releaseNotes": "[https://github.com/…](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/releases/v4.3.0)"
    }
  ]
}
```

It is planned for pre-releases to be directed to the release they were a pre-release for (e.g. `4.3.0-beta1` would get `4.3.0` as an update) if it exists, or otherwise stay within their pre-release channel (e.g. `4.3.0-beta1` → `4.3.0-rc1`; `4.3.0-nightly.2023-11-10` → `4.3.0-nightly.2023-11-15`; `4.3.0-dev.1` → `4.3.0-dev.2`)

## Change to the `mastodon:setup` task

When setting up a new server, the `mastodon:setup` task now asks (defaulting to `yes`):
> Do you want Mastodon to periodically check for important updates and notify you? (Recommended)

Should the admin reply no, `UPDATE_CHECK_URL` will be set to an empty string in the generated environment.

## Per-admin e-mail notification settings

Individual users with the “DevOps” role can chose which notifications to receive by selecting between:
- “Never notify of updates (not recommended)”
- “Notify on critical updates only” (default)
- “Notify on bugfix updates”
- “Notify on all updates”

![image](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/assets/384364/36e12360-88b7-4573-bd32-664b7823cc8f)

![image](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/assets/384364/760690cc-8ef8-46c2-b811-4e7054c8ee3a)

## New item in admin/settings navbar

Only present when critical updates are available, cannot be disabled (except for setting `UPDATE_CHECK_URL` to a blank value).

![image](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/assets/384364/d63c261e-0821-4b15-ae5c-1d1de4df41e2)

## Admin dashboard check

![image](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/assets/384364/ef3ebe68-bd22-43e7-8349-05ec2c663f2a)
![image](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/assets/384364/a1bb84e6-6869-41f9-a2b2-aefa3db99945)

## Banner in Home timeline

Only present when critical updates are available, cannot be disabled (except for setting `UPDATE_CHECK_URL` to a blank value).

![image](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/assets/384364/6826a0db-25bf-45cc-bc9b-41867f043f54)

## Available updates listing

![image](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/assets/384364/f50316c4-dbce-4eaa-b515-7149fe2bf5a2)

commit.commit_title: Fix invalid Content-Type header for WebP images (#26773)

prs.pr_title: Fix invalid Content-Type header for WebP images
prs.pr_body:
When using Rails to serve files, WebP images are served with `Content-Type: text/plain`.

This is because [Rack 2.2 does not support image/webp](https://github.com/rack/rack/blob/2-2-stable/lib/rack/mime.rb). Upgrading to Rack 3 [requires upgrading Sprockets,](https://github.com/rails/sprockets/blob/3.x/sprockets.gemspec#L14) and that is a bigger task (I am not familiar with the upgrade process).

commit.commit_title: Fix `#hashtag` matching non-hashtagged posts in search (#26781)

prs.pr_title: Fix `#hashtag` matching non-hashtagged posts in search
prs.pr_body: The hashtags of a post will now be indexed in a separate field. Each search term that begins with a `#` will match against specifically that field. This has the benefit of being able to find posts where the hashtags are not in the body of the post. I also added the word delimiter graph filter to the tags index. That means that if we index something like `FooBar` (i.e. camel case, or snake case) we'll be able to find it when searching for `bar` as much as `foo`. Previously, only `foo` would bring it up thanks to the edge n-gram field.

issues.issue_title: DRYing out icon code
issues.issue_body:
This PR creates a component for icons so that changes to icons in the future can be made in just one place 💯 

Just removes duplication for now but does so as a step
towards #1469

also see #1349 which proposes adding descriptive text to icons (for the toolbar but eventually would be great across the board)



### Usage
The Icon component just takes the name of the icon now:
```js
  <Icon icon={this.props.icon} />
```

You can pass an `active` property which will add an `.active` class to the icon.
```js
  <Icon icon={this.props.icon} active={true} />
```

You can also pass a `fixedWidth` property which will add a `fa-fw` class to the icon:
```js
  <Icon icon={this.props.icon} fixedWidth={true} />
```

or override the `iconPrefix`:
```js
  <Icon icon={this.props.icon} iconPrefix="foo" />
```

The Icon component sets the `className` for you. If for some reason you want to override this, pass a `className` property.
```js
  <Icon icon={this.props.icon} className={`foo foo-${this.props.icon} foo-bar`} />
```

issues.issue_title: Language Kurmancî shows up twice
issues.issue_body:
### Steps to reproduce the problem

1. Open the language picker
2. Type "Kurdish"
3. See that Kurmancî (kmr/ku) is listed twice

![Screenshot_2022-12-10-12-00-44-290-edit_com kiwibrowser browser](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6217438/206851756-ef14ca89-35a8-4f2b-a3e2-da4ac711bef3.jpg)


### Expected behaviour

Each language should be listed just once

### Actual behaviour

Kurmancî is being listed twice (kmr and ku)

### Detailed description

While trying to figure out which languages my Mastodon client should support (the API docs just say "ISO 639 language code", which should probably be specified – there's no way to query the supported languages, is there?) and after hearing that some [ISO 639-3 languages are missing](https://github.com/sk22/megalodon/issues/139) from Java's ISO 639-1 language list, I looked up the `LanguagesHelper` module, where I found two lines for the same (?) language:

```
ku: ['Kurmanji (Kurdish)', 'Kurmancî']
…
kmr: ['Kurmanji (Kurdish)', 'Kurmancî']
```

### Specifications

Mastodon v4.0.2

issues.issue_body:

suitability for kurmacî language users

prs.pr_title: Bump version to v4.2.0-beta3
prs.pr_body:
Changelog with regards to v4.2.0-beta2

### Added

- **Add full-text search of opted-in public posts and rework search operators** ([Gargron](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26485), [jsgoldstein](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26344), [ClearlyClaire](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26657), [ClearlyClaire](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26650), [jsgoldstein](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26659), [Gargron](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26660), [Gargron](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26663), [Gargron](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26688), [Gargron](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26689), [Gargron](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26686), [Gargron](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26687), [Gargron](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26692), [ClearlyClaire](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26697), [Gargron](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26699), [Gargron](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26701), [ClearlyClaire](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26710), [ClearlyClaire](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26739), [ClearlyClaire](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26754), [Gargron](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26662), [ClearlyClaire](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26755), [Gargron](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26782), [Gargron](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26781), [Gargron](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26760))
  This introduces a new `public_statuses` Elasticsearch index for public posts by users who have opted in to their posts being searchable (`toot#indexable` flag).
  This also revisits the other indexes to provide more useful indexing, and adds new search operators such as `from:me`, `before:2022-11-01`, `after:2022-11-01`, `during:2022-11-01`, `language:fr`, `has:poll`, or `in:library` (for searching only in posts you have written or interacted with).
  Results are now ordered chronologically.
- **Add admin notifications for new Mastodon versions** ([ClearlyClaire](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26582))
  This is done by querying `https://api.joinmastodon.org/update-check` every 30 minutes in a background job.
  That URL can be changed using the `UPDATE_CHECK_URL` environment variable, and the feature outright disabled by setting that variable to an empty string (`UPDATE_CHECK_URL=`).
- Add `authorized_fetch` server setting in addition to env var ([ClearlyClaire](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/25798))
- Add avatar image to webfinger responses ([tvler](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26558))
- Add an explanation banner on switching to single column mode ([Signez](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26019), [Signez](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26759))
- Add debug logging on signature verification failure ([ClearlyClaire](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26637))
- Add explicit error messages when DeepL quota is exceeded ([lutoma](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26704))
- Add Elasticsearch/OpenSearch version to “Software” in admin dashboard ([ClearlyClaire](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26652))
- Add `data-nosnippet` attribute to remote posts and local posts with `noindex` ([ClearlyClaire](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26648))
- Add support for federating `memorial` attribute ([rrgeorge](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26583))
- Add Cherokee and Kalmyk to languages dropdown ([gunchleoc](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26012), [gunchleoc](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26013))

### Changed

- Change from `node-redis` to `ioredis` for streaming ([gmemstr](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26581))
- Change private statuses index to index without crutches ([ClearlyClaire](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26713))
- Change video compression parameters ([Gargron](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26631), [Gargron](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26745), [Gargron](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26766))
- Change the pre-release versioning scheme and associated environment variables ([sinoru](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26591), [ClearlyClaire](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26626), [ClearlyClaire](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26653), [ClearlyClaire](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26676))
- Change admin e-mail notification settings to be their own settings group ([ClearlyClaire](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26596))
- Change opacity of the delete icon in the search field to be more visible ([AntoninDelFabbro](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26449))
- Change hashtag bar tags to be de-emphasized ([ClearlyClaire](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26606), [Gargron](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26666))
- Change the hashtag bar to be hidden when there is a CW and the post is not expanded ([renchap](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26615))
- Change Account Search to prioritize username over display name ([jsgoldstein](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26623))

### Removed

- Remove `kmr` from language selection, as it was a duplicate for `ku` ([gunchleoc](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26014), [ClearlyClaire](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26787))

### Fixed

- Fix invalid `Content-Type` header for WebP images ([c960657](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26773))
- Fix wrong color on active icons with counters in web UI ([Gargron](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26767))
- Fix minor inefficiencies in `tootctl search deploy` ([ClearlyClaire](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26721))
- Fix `AddUniqueIndexOnPreviewCardsStatuses` migration requiring PostgreSQL 12+ in some cases ([ClearlyClaire](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26737))
- Fix filter form in profiles directory overflowing instead of wrapping ([arbolitoloco1](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26682))
- Fix `/api/v1/timelines/tag/:hashtag` allowing for unauthenticated access when public preview is disabled ([danielmbrasil](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26237))
- Fix inefficiencies in `PlainTextFormatter` ([ClearlyClaire](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26727))
- Fix sign up steps progress layout in right-to-left locales ([ClearlyClaire](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26728))
- Fix bug with “favorited by” and “reblogged by“ view on posts only showing up to 40 items ([timothyjrogers](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26577), [timothyjrogers](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26574))
- Fix bad search type heuristic ([Gargron](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26673))
- Fix not being able to negate prefix clauses in search ([Gargron](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26672))
- Fix toast saying "published" instead of "saved" after editing post in web UI ([Gargron](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26664))
- Fix clicking “Explore” or “Live feeds” column headers to scroll in advanced mode ([ClearlyClaire](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26633))
- Fix selecting domains to forward reports not passing the information correctly ([ClearlyClaire](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26636))
- Fix timeout on invalid set of exclusionary parameters in `/api/v1/timelines/public` ([danielmbrasil](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26239))
- Fix unexpected audio stream transcoding when uploaded video is eligible to passthrough ([yufushiro](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26608))
- Fix hashtag normalization when displaying a post ([renchap](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26614))
- Fix admin dashboard check when using Elasticsearch with `ES_PREFIX` ([ClearlyClaire](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26605), [ClearlyClaire](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26658))
- Fix layout of the closed registrations modal ([ClearlyClaire](https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/26593))
